circumstances: Julian Hughes, an 8-year-old foster child, was discovered missing from his home on Cunzie Street. A friend reported seeing him last at a restaurant near Langlands Road and then at a dock/marina, where he seemed fascinated by the maps of the Highlands. It was later revealed that he was on a spiritual pilgrimage. A concerned colleague presumed he might be squatting along the highway. He was found safe in Kinghorn.

circumstances: Julian Hughes, an eight-year-old boy with a disability, went missing during a family outing at a local restaurant after attending an after-school program. Julian was last seen near Wood Road, Rosyth, KY11 2EA, accompanied by his foster sister, Jessica Davies, and their mutual friend, Rosie. He was fascinated by maps of the Highlands and frequently talked about visiting the area. After dinner, while the group was taking a walk near the nearby dock/marina, Julian wandered off unnoticed. As the group realized his absence, an immediate search ensued, centering around the restaurant and marina areas. Fortunately, after several anxious hours, Julian was traced by staff members at a nearby location safe and unharmed, having followed the maps in his imagination to explore new places.

circumstances: Julian Hughes, an 8-year-old boy from Anstruther, went missing under unclear circumstances. His sudden disappearance on a Monday caused concern among neighbors and family friends, including his close friend, Liam Sykes. Julian was known to have a keen interest in maps of the Highlands, which fueled theories about his intentions. The investigation focused on several key areas, including the bustling dock/marina near 34 Pettycur Bay, Kinghorn, KY3 9SB, and he was also spotted near the highway leading away from his home at 1 Collinswell Drive, Burntisland, KY3 0AU. After five days of community searches and police efforts, Julian was found safe at a nearby location.

Concern arose when Julian, known to have maps of the Highlands, vanished after mentioning a desire for a spiritual pilgrimage. Julian was located safe at 1 Fidra Avenue, Burntisland, by staff.
